chapter.title: Planned features
chapter.para: Planned features for the subsequent releases of wasp.

section.title: API release
section.para: Finalization of WASP API. Consolidate service layer, refactor project and model objects.

section.title: Command line application
section.para: Develop command line application using Spring Integration and JMS. Allows the superuser to perform administrative tasks and regular users to access metadata at the command line. Will serve as a template for users who want to develop applications that interact with the WASP framework.

section.title: WASP remote execution
section.para: Partition WASP job flows out to other wasp instances.

listitem.para: Message comes from untrusted source and is discarded.
Message comes from trusted source, but is discarded because the proper security credentials are not presented.
Message is accepted, but handshake fails due to mismatch between available resources (eg. reference) genomes, software versions).
Successful handshake, server responds that it can offer n computational units.
Client creates partition strategy and partitions data among willing server instances.
Server obtains partition strategy and obtains subset of data based on it.
Servers that are unable to obtain respond that the step has failed.
Successfully obtained data sets are locally submitted to the grid.
Results are summarized and a strategy for obtaining results are returned to the client with result, success.
